intro: Noccaea microstyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, with a hairy surface that helps reduce water loss. Noccaea microstyla typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
